name: Adriel's Chinese Curry Chicken
author: BlondeCook
summary: My husband is Chinese and this is one of our favorite dishes. My late father-in-law, who used to be a Chinese chef, said my version of this was better than his! Yellow curry paste can be found at an Asian market. You may have to add a little more or less curry paste, depending on your taste. I included a more moderate amount in this recipe. I suggest serving this over cooked jasmine rice. It has a little bit of heat, so probably do not serve to small children. Enjoy!
ingredients: 3  skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, sliced
directions: In a bowl, mash the yellow curry paste with about 2 tablespoons of chicken broth to help dissolve the paste; whisk in remaining chicken broth, sugar, curry powder, salt, light soy sauce, and coconut milk
Heat a wok or large skillet over high heat for about 30 seconds; pour in the oil
Let the oil heat until shimmering, about 30 more seconds
Stir the chicken, garlic, and ginger into the hot oil; cook and stir until the chicken has begun to brown and the garlic and ginger are fragrant, about 2 minutes
Stir in the onion and potatoes, toss all ingredients in the hot oil, and pour in the sauce mixture
Bring the sauce to a boil, reduce heat, and cover the wok
Simmer until the chicken is cooked through and the potatoes are tender, 20 to 25 minutes
